meanings.definition: The division of a religion into separate organized groups or sects.
meanings.sent1: Denominationalism can lead to different churches having unique practices.
meanings.sent2: In some countries, denominationalism has resulted in various religious institutions.
meanings.sent3: At the denominationalism conference, each group showcased their distinct traditions.
meanings.sent4: The denominationalism in the community was like a colorful tapestry of faiths.
meanings.sent5: The history of denominationalism is a complex web of religious diversity.

meanings.definition: The belief that one's own denomination is the truest form of Christianity.
meanings.sent1: Her strong denominationalism made her loyal to her church above all.
meanings.sent2: Denominationalism can sometimes lead to disagreements among believers.
meanings.sent3: His denominationalism was so intense, he only attended services at his church.
meanings.sent4: In his eyes, denominationalism was like a competition for the ultimate truth.
meanings.sent5: The fervor of her denominationalism shone brightly in her unwavering faith.
